io.spine.server

Class ServerEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.ServerEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class ServerEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The server conditions and configuration under which the application operates.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static ServerEnvironment instance()
        Returns a singleton instance.

      • deploymentType

        public io.spine.server.DeploymentType deploymentType()
        The type of the environment application is deployed to.

      • configureDelivery

        public void configureDelivery(Delivery delivery)
        Updates the delivery for this environment.

        This method is most typically used upon an application start. It's very uncommon and even dangerous to update the delivery mechanism later when the message delivery process may have been already used by various BoundedContexts.

      • delivery

        public Delivery delivery()
        Returns the delivery mechanism specific to this environment.

        Unless updated manually, returns a local implementation of Delivery.

      • newCommandScheduler

        public CommandScheduler newCommandScheduler()
        Obtains command scheduling mechanism used by CommandBus in this environment.

      • scheduleCommandsUsing

        public void scheduleCommandsUsing(java.util.function.Supplier<CommandScheduler> commandScheduler)
        Assigns command scheduling mechanism used at this environment by all CommandBus instances.

        If not configured, ExecutorCommandScheduler is used.

      • nodeId

        public io.spine.server.NodeId nodeId()
        Obtains the identifier of the server node, on which this code is running at the moment.

        At the moment, the node identifier is always UUID-generated. In future versions of the framework it is expected to become configurable.

      • configureDeployment

        public void configureDeployment(java.util.function.Supplier<io.spine.server.DeploymentType> supplier)
        Makes the ServerEnvironment.deploymentType() return the values from the provided supplier.

        When supplying your own deployment type in tests, remember to reset it during tear down.

      • configureStorage

        public void configureStorage(StorageFactory productionStorageFactory)
        Assigns StorageFactory for the production mode of the application.
        See Also:
        ServerEnvironment.configureStorageForTests(StorageFactory)

      • configureStorageForTests

        public void configureStorageForTests(StorageFactory factory)
        Assigns StorageFactory for tests.
        See Also:
        ServerEnvironment.configureStorage(StorageFactory)

      • configureTracing

        public void configureTracing(TracerFactory tracerFactory)
        Assigns TracerFactory to this server environment.

      • tracing

        public java.util.Optional<TracerFactory> tracing()
        Obtains TracerFactory associated with this server environment.

      • storageFactory

        public StorageFactory storageFactory()
        Obtains production StorageFactory previously associated with the environment.
        Returns:
        StorageFactory instance for the production storage
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the production StorageFactory was not configured prior to the call

      • configureTransport

        public void configureTransport(TransportFactory transportFactory)
        Assigns TransportFactory for the production mode of the application.

      • transportFactory

        public TransportFactory transportFactory()
        Obtains TransportFactory associated with this server environment.

        If the factory is not assigned in the Production mode, throws NullPointerException with the instruction to call ServerEnvironment.configureTransport(TransportFactory).

        If the factory is not assigned in the Tests mode, assigns the instance of InMemoryTransportFactory and returns it.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This is test-only method required for cleaning of the server environment instance in tests.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Releases resources associated with this instance.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
